intro: Centaurea cineraria var. sirenum, commonly known as the Sirene thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its silver-gray, fuzzy leaves and striking purple-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features include a sturdy stem with bracts that form a basal rosette, and it produces achenes as its seeds. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
